result.execSummary:
The defendant Courtney Marie McConnach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Writings or Objects [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham January 13, 2017 - Defendant may serve in Dunn County Jail at no expense to St. Croix County and she must make the arrangements.

miscConds.notes: Monthly installments of $360.00 paid to the Clerk of Courts Office. First payment due on September 15th, 2015 and on the 15th of the month there after

- Cooperate with law enforcement and provide truthful testimony in 14CF545 and 14CF546

-  Participate in Restorative Justice Impact Panel

-  Expungement will be reviewed upon successful completion of all conditions of probation.

timeConds.notes: Jail to be served in 30 day increments. Time to be arranged by agent

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Charles S. Huff DF: Courtney Marie McConnach appeared. Case called at 2:31. ADA Hartung updates the court and makes recommendations. Ms. Wolfe makes statement.  Atty. Huff responds. DE makes a statement. Court orders:
Sentence W/H
3 years probation with conditions:
90 days county jail to be served in 30 day increments. Time to be arranged with agent. 
Huber granted for work. 
- restitution of 13,930.00 installments of not less than $360.00 per month through the Clerk of Courts Office. 
  First payment due on Sept. 15 and on the 15th of every month there after. 
- cooperate with law enforcement
- DE to provide truthful testimony in 14CF545, 14CF546. 
- restorative justice impact panel.
Expungement will be reviewed after successful completion of probation.
Sentencing hearing at 08-20-2015 02:30 pm

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.  ADA: Matthew Hartung/ DF ATTY: Charles S. Huff DF:  Courtney Marie McConnach appeared. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 14CF547. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in 14CF547. On motion of the State without objection, Crt reads in and dismisses Ct 2-31 with prejudice in 14CF547. Court waives a PSI. Court delays sentencing until the victims are available to be in court. Bond continues. DE will make a restitution payment today.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Filed by Atty Huff. Requesting a continuance of 7/29/2015 Plea. Hearing reset. km

Regarding Media. Signed by SRN on 2/19/2015. km
Preliminary hearing on April 23, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

-  Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Mark W. or current guardian.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
